content.raw: I look into it a little. In *CameraSensor classes, `Sensor::Fini` is now called after the camera is removed - this then removes the ogre viewport and the attached compositor instances which causes the above listener to be an invalid pointer.  So I think it's fine to remove this bit of code since ogre takes care of the destruction of these objects for us.
content.html: I look into it a little. In *CameraSensor classes, Sensor::Fini is now called after the camera is removed - this then removes the ogre viewport and the attached compositor instances which causes the above listener to be an invalid pointer. So I think it's fine to remove this bit of code since ogre takes care of the destruction of these objects for us.

content.html: Cool, thanks for digging

content.raw: I was debugging an occasional failure of the `INTEGRATION_joint_revolute` test during one of the bullet sub-tests after a `Joint::Detach` function is called. The error occurs since that function is basically deleting the joint without calling Fini, so the applyDamping callback might cause problems. Please consider merging a132f13 (branch `bullet_joint_teardown`) into this pull request.
content.html: I was debugging an occasional failure of the INTEGRATION_joint_revolute test during one of the bullet sub-tests after a Joint::Detach function is called. The error occurs since that function is basically deleting the joint without calling Fini, so the applyDamping callback might cause problems. Please consider merging a132f13 (branch bullet_joint_teardown) into this pull request.

content.html: Thanks! Merged and also added disconnects d6a207e

content.raw: The disconnects aren't necessary; the `reset()` call will take care of everything. My next pull request for the Event refactoring is actually to deprecate all the `Event::Disconnect` API's, since I think calling `reset()` is easier.
content.html: The disconnects aren't necessary; the reset() call will take care of everything. My next pull request for the Event refactoring is actually to deprecate all the Event::Disconnect API's, since I think calling reset() is easier.

content.raw: Oh cool! But that will go into default, right?
content.html: Oh cool! But that will go into default, right?

content.raw: Yes, that will go into default, but the `Disconnect` functions are not required even on gazebo7. Only a pointer `reset()` is required. The deprecation on default will just force the issue.
content.html: Yes, that will go into default, but the Disconnect functions are not required even on gazebo7. Only a pointer reset() is required. The deprecation on default will just force the issue.
